careerBackground: I grew up playing sport. I captained South England Schoolboys, defended for Norwich City and played No.10 for Oxford University’s First XI. Injury led me to a Fine Art degree at Oxford. Graduation guided me to technology. I gained a scholarship to undertake my Masters in ‘Interactive Technology’ at NYU in New York City. Whilst in NYC, I worked on technology projects spanning Digital, Mobile, Web and Connected Hardware.
superHeroPower: Conducting personal theme tunes. I admire Wes Anderson and am inspired by Hans Zimmer. It would be magical to conduct independent, ongoing, life-long melodies.
